net.adamcin.oakpal.maven.mojo

Class VerifyMojo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      • net.adamcin.oakpal.maven.mojo.VerifyMojo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MojoWithCommonParams, MojoWithRepositoryParams, org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo

    @Mojo(name="verify",
      defaultPhase=VERIFY,
      configurator="oakpal")
public class VerifyMojo
extends org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
    Deferred reporting and reacting to oakpal check reports during the verify phase.
    Since:
    1.1.0

      boolean isTestScopeContainer()
      There are basically two use cases for the oakpal-maven-plugin: 1) Adhoc testing of a content-package project artifact, in which case all oakpal classpath resources will be found in test scope, or 2) Creation and testing of an oakpal module with checklists, and/or creation and testing of an opear archive, in which case all oakpal classpath resources will be found in a non-test scope classpath.

      • failOnSeverity

        @Parameter(defaultValue="MAJOR")
protected net.adamcin.oakpal.core.Violation.Severity failOnSeverity
        Specify the minimum violation severity level that will trigger plugin execution failure. Valid options are Violation.Severity.MINOR, Violation.Severity.MAJOR, and Violation.Severity.SEVERE.

        FYI: FileVault Importer errors are reported as MAJOR by default.

        Since:
        0.1.0

      • isIndividuallySkipped

        protected boolean isIndividuallySkipped()

      • isTestScopeContainer

        public boolean isTestScopeContainer()
        Description copied from interface: MojoWithRepositoryParams
        There are basically two use cases for the oakpal-maven-plugin: 1) Adhoc testing of a content-package project artifact, in which case all oakpal classpath resources will be found in test scope, or 2) Creation and testing of an oakpal module with checklists, and/or creation and testing of an opear archive, in which case all oakpal classpath resources will be found in a non-test scope classpath. Mojos should override this method to return true, to specify that a test-scope classloader is desired, as in the first case.
        Returns:
        true if a test-scope classloader is desired, or false if a non-test-scope classloader is desired.
